channel.title: Custom Daily Quotes - Deep & Reflective
channel.description: A full year of daily inspirational quotes for leadership, resilience, justice, and growth.

item.title: Charles Glassman
item.description: “Kindness begins with the understanding that we all struggle.”

item.title: Tiffany Yu
item.description: “My disability is not the biggest barrier I face. My biggest barriers are attitudes and systems.”

item.title: Mr. Rogers
item.description: “There’s no person in the whole world like you, and I like you just the way you are.”

item.title: Mother Teresa
item.description: “Do not wait for leaders. Do it alone, person to person.”

item.title: Angela Duckworth
item.description: “Enthusiasm is common. Endurance is rare.”

item.title: Malala Yousafzai
item.description: “One child, one teacher, one book, and one pen can change the world.”

item.title: Nelson Mandela
item.description: “It always seems impossible until it’s done.”

item.title: Robert Emmons
item.description: “People who have a strong disposition toward gratitude have the capacity to be happier.”

item.title: Mother Teresa
item.description: “Do not wait for leaders. Do it alone, person to person.”

item.title: Viktor Frankl
item.description: “When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.”

item.title: Edmund Hillary
item.description: “It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.”

item.title: Mother Teresa
item.description: “Do not wait for leaders. Do it alone, person to person.”

item.title: Voltaire
item.description: “Appreciation is a wonderful thing. It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.”

item.title: Simon Sinek
item.description: “Leadership is not about being in charge. It is about taking care of those in your charge.”

item.title: Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: “To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.”

item.title: Nelson Mandela
item.description: “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.”

item.title: Serena Williams
item.description: “A champion is defined not by their wins but by how they can recover when they fall.”

item.title: Mr. Rogers
item.description: “There’s no person in the whole world like you, and I like you just the way you are.”

item.title: Simon Sinek
item.description: “Leadership is not about being in charge. It is about taking care of those in your charge.”

item.title: Auli'i Cravalho
item.description: “Adversity is just change that we haven’t adapted to yet.”

item.title: Nelson Mandela
item.description: “It always seems impossible until it’s done.”

item.title: Sheryl Sandberg
item.description: “Leadership is about making others better as a result of your presence.”

item.title: George Eliot
item.description: “Adventure is not outside man; it is within.”

item.title: Mr. Rogers
item.description: “There’s no person in the whole world like you, and I like you just the way you are.”

item.title: Mary Holloway
item.description: “Resilience is knowing that you are the only one that has the power and the responsibility to pick yourself up.”

item.title: Ken Robinson
item.description: “If you're not prepared to be wrong, you'll never come up with anything original.”

item.title: Aesop
item.description: “Gratitude turns what we have into enough.”

item.title: Stuart Scott
item.description: “Don’t downgrade your dream just to fit your reality. Upgrade your conviction to match your destiny.”

item.title: Winston Churchill
item.description: “Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.”

item.title: Voltaire
item.description: “Appreciation is a wonderful thing. It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.”

item.title: Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: “What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.”

item.title: Nelson Mandela
item.description: “It always seems impossible until it’s done.”

item.title: Toni Morrison
item.description: “You are your best thing.”

item.title: Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: “To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.”

item.title: Angela Duckworth
item.description: “Enthusiasm is common. Endurance is rare.”

item.title: Unknown
item.description: “The difference between stumbling blocks and stepping stones is how you use them.”

item.title: Tony Robbins
item.description: “Change is never a matter of ability. It’s always a matter of motivation.”

item.title: Maya Angelou
item.description: “I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.”

item.title: Harold Geneen
item.description: “Leadership is practiced not so much in words as in attitude and in actions.”

item.title: Unknown
item.description: “The difference between stumbling blocks and stepping stones is how you use them.”

item.title: Adam Grant
item.description: “Helping others is the way we help ourselves.”

item.title: Winston Churchill
item.description: “Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.”

item.title: Nelson Mandela
item.description: “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.”

item.title: Charlie Day
item.description: “You don’t have to be fearless, just don’t let fear stop you.”

item.title: Angela Duckworth
item.description: “Enthusiasm is common. Endurance is rare.”

item.title: Jordan Peterson
item.description: “Compare yourself to who you were yesterday, not to who someone else is today.”

item.title: Auli'i Cravalho
item.description: “Adversity is just change that we haven’t adapted to yet.”

item.title: Harold Geneen
item.description: “Leadership is practiced not so much in words as in attitude and in actions.”

item.title: Charlie Day
item.description: “You don’t have to be fearless, just don’t let fear stop you.”

item.title: Viktor Frankl
item.description: “When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.”

item.title: Simon Sinek
item.description: “Leadership is not about being in charge. It is about taking care of those in your charge.”

item.title: Brené Brown
item.description: “Courage is contagious. Every time we choose courage, we make everyone around us a little better.”

item.title: Viktor Frankl
item.description: “When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.”

item.title: Margaret Wheatley
item.description: “Be brave enough to start a conversation that matters.”

item.title: Margaret Wheatley
item.description: “There is no power for change greater than a community discovering what it cares about.”

item.title: Margaret Wheatley
item.description: “Be brave enough to start a conversation that matters.”

item.title: George Eliot
item.description: “Adventure is not outside man; it is within.”

item.title: Kimberlé Crenshaw
item.description: “Intersectionality is a lens through which you can see where power comes and collides.”

item.title: Unknown
item.description: “The difference between stumbling blocks and stepping stones is how you use them.”

item.title: Serena Williams
item.description: “A champion is defined not by their wins but by how they can recover when they fall.”

item.title: Robert Frost
item.description: “The best way out is always through.”

item.title: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
item.description: “Hard things will happen to us. We will recover, we will learn, we will grow.”

item.title: Voltaire
item.description: “Appreciation is a wonderful thing. It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.”

item.title: Tiffany Yu
item.description: “My disability is not the biggest barrier I face. My biggest barriers are attitudes and systems.”

item.title: Brené Brown
item.description: “Courage is contagious. Every time we choose courage, we make everyone around us a little better.”

item.title: Simon Sinek
item.description: “Leadership is not about being in charge. It is about taking care of those in your charge.”

item.title: Mary Holloway
item.description: “Resilience is knowing that you are the only one that has the power and the responsibility to pick yourself up.”

item.title: Jon Kabat-Zinn
item.description: “You can’t stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.”

item.title: Maya Angelou
item.description: “Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.”

item.title: Charles Glassman
item.description: “Kindness begins with the understanding that we all struggle.”

item.title: Oliver Wendell Holmes
item.description: “A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.”

item.title: Maya Angelou
item.description: “When you learn, teach. When you get, give.”

item.title: Tony Robbins
item.description: “Change is never a matter of ability. It’s always a matter of motivation.”

item.title: Steven Callahan
item.description: “Even in the face of devastation, hope is not lost.”

item.title: Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: “Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.”

item.title: Ken Robinson
item.description: “If you're not prepared to be wrong, you'll never come up with anything original.”

item.title: Aesop
item.description: “Gratitude turns what we have into enough.”

item.title: bell hooks
item.description: “What we do is more important than what we say or what we say we believe.”

item.title: Serena Williams
item.description: “A champion is defined not by their wins but by how they can recover when they fall.”

item.title: Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: “Learning never exhausts the mind.”

item.title: Nelson Mandela
item.description: “It always seems impossible until it’s done.”

item.title: Mary Oliver
item.description: “Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?”

item.description: “You can’t stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.”

item.title: William James
item.description: “Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.”

item.description: “Change is never a matter of ability. It’s always a matter of motivation.”

item.title: George Eliot
item.description: “Adventure is not outside man; it is within.”

item.description: “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.”

item.title: Auli'i Cravalho
item.description: “Adversity is just change that we haven’t adapted to yet.”

item.title: Voltaire
item.description: “Appreciation is a wonderful thing. It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.”

item.description: “Leadership is practiced not so much in words as in attitude and in actions.”

item.title: Robert Frost
item.description: “The best way out is always through.”

item.title: Winston Churchill
item.description: “Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.”

item.description: “If you're not prepared to be wrong, you'll never come up with anything original.”

item.description: “Gratitude turns what we have into enough.”
